qas.question: What Buddhism emerged in the second half of the 20th century in Japan?
What does Soka Gakkai mean in English?
What Buddhist movement has linked more than 12 million people?
What is the largest Buddhist movement in the world?

context: In the second half of the 20th Century a modern movement in <a0_0>Nichiren Buddhism: Soka Gakkai<a0_0/> (<a1_0>Value Creation Society<a1_0/>) emerged in Japan and spread further to other countries. <a2_0>Soka Gakkai International<a2_0/> (<a3_0>SGI<a3_0/>) is a lay Buddhist movement linking more than 12 million people around the world, and is currently described as "the most diverse" and "the largest lay Buddhist movement in the world".[web 21]
